article: The night started out ordinarily enough. Jack and Tara, our  _  , were in their small beds surrounded by toy animals. My husband, Pat, and I went to sleep  _  .  Sometime  after midnight, Jack quietly touched me. "Mommy, I want to stay with you. I promise I won't take much room." I shifted  _  to make room. My son soon fell asleep. An hour later, Tara cried and I carefully went downstairs. "Mommy, my  _  is all stuffed up . I can't really breathe very well. Will you please  _  with me a little while?" Tara doesn't often get up at night,  so  I decided to be there for her. She soon fell asleep. I returned to my own bed. I was determined to sleep. But to my  _  , I found Jack sleeping on my side of the bed. He looked so  _  that I couldn't remove him. Quietly and carefully, I lay down between  Pat  and Jack. I did manage to get some sleep  _  I heard Tara's voice again. I returned to  look after  Tara. "Mom, please lie down with me a little bit, I had a bad dream, and I'm so  _  ." "Of course, honey. It was only a dream. Mommy's here and  _  is okay." We fell asleep  _  each other's arms. Even in my sleepy state, I thought of  how soon  these nights of merry-go-round beds will be over. In their place, my twins will be grown.  No doubt  before I'm ready, our children' rooms will be much too  _  and empty. So it is especially on days when I'm worn out after a night on this mom's merry-go-round that I remind  myself  that these very days and nights are, in fact. "the good old days", ever so  _  .
